sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
His Majesties declaration to all his loving subjects; shewing his true intentions in advancing lately to Brainford: together with the answer of both Houses of Parliament to his message of the 12th of November; with His Majesties reply thereunto. Falkland, Lucius Cary, Viscount, 1610?-1643. Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I). England and Wales. Parliament.
[2], 14 p.
Printed by Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Majestie: And by the assignes of John Bill, London : MDCXLII. [1642]
Actually written by Lord Falkland -- Cf. Madan 1082. Reprints "the Parliamentary petition of Nov. 9 received by the King on the 11th, his answer of the 11th, and his Message of Nov. 12." -- Cf. Madan 1082. Another edition of: His Majesties declaration to all his loving subjects, of his true intentions in advancing lately to Brainceford. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Decemb: 2d". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Falkland, Lucius Cary, Viscount, 1610?-1643. Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I). England and Wales. Parliament.
[2], 14 p.
Printed by Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Majestie: And by the assignes of John Bill, London : MDCXLII. [1642]
Actually written by Lord Falkland -- Cf. Madan 1082. Reprints "the Parliamentary petition of Nov. 9 received by the King on the 11th, his answer of the 11th, and his Message of Nov. 12." -- Cf. Madan 1082. Another edition of: His Majesties declaration to all his loving subjects, of his true intentions in advancing lately to Brainceford. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Decemb: 2d". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

Robert Barker
